availability.p: © Duke Databank of Documentary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.

revisionDesc.change: Submit - I gave a slightly revised version of this text (as P.Poetke 39) in ZPE 186 (2013) 273. In the republication as P.Monts.Roca IV 75, the editors did not share my views. For lin1, they note: "Although the personal name suggested by Gonis is much more frequent . . ., we do not see however the abbreviation mark for the preposition παρ(ὰ), and we clearly read an epsilon rather than an alpha. His reading Πέτρ(ο)υ is not better than our Πετρω(νίου)." The abbreviation is indicated by a supralinear horizontal stroke, and α is clear on the online image, at http://dvctvs.upf.edu/foto/460/PMR498r.jpg (dot no needed); and the raised letter at the end of the line is υ, not ω. The other contentious issue is the end of lin2, where I suggested Ἑρμοῦ πόλ(εως) by me, in place of Ἑρμοπολ( ) of ed. pr., with Ἑρμοπολ(ίτου) suggested by Morelli). The editors print Ἑρμουπολ(ίτου), accepting my reading of "an upsilon right above the pi", but they "prefer the resolution with the name of the nome". This however is unparalleled. The σκέλος here refers to the pagarchy, which bears the name of the city. — Rename as p.monts.roca;4;75 at finalization.

text copied and edited.
l.1: I added para in brackets, but the reading at the end of the line is incorrect as I know from unpublished corrections of N. Gonis. (In fact, para is there and other names should be read.) l.2: The second correction stems from F. Morelli and not Th. Kruse as it is mentioned in a footnote in APF.

div.ab:
Μεχεὶρ ιη ἰνδικτίωνος ιβ. ἔσχον παρὰ ΣίωνοςΣίων ΠέτρουΠερσίωνοςΠερσίων Πετρωνίου
ἀπὸ ἐξκεπτόρων πρίγκιπος νοτίνου σκέλους Ἑρμοῦ πόλεωςἙρμουπολίτου
καταβληθὲν ἐφ’ ἡμᾶς ὑπὲρ δημοσίων καὶ ἄλλων
ἑνδεκάτης ἰνδικτίωνος ἔτους ρθ ἀρίθμιον νόμισμα α ἕν μόνον. Σευῆρος στοιχεῖ
